attributes.action: live-in carers need to be paid  the same hourly rate as other carers and support workers in the health sector
attributes.additional_details: live-in-careers who provide 24  hour care in the clients home are being paid as low as £400 gross salary a week which works out to be £2.38 per hour which falls well short of the minimum hourly wage. Whereas carers and support workers who provide 24 hour care but on  8 hour or 12 hour shifts are paid  rates of up to £15 an hour.This is an unfair and illegal labor practice which needs to  be redressed as a matter of agency.
